file_content.text: Your courage saved a lot of people. We all owe you thanks, especially the Gen'Dai.
I wish there had been another way, but at least the disease is under control. Thanks.
We aren't finding any more infected Gen'Dai on the scanners. With the carriers dead, the disease will die out pretty quickly.
Doctor Fash is still upset that we had to sacrifice them, but she'll realize it had to be done.
I wish there had been another way, but we had to act quickly.
Our safety is worth the price.
You'll get no argument from me. As for Doctor Fash, well, she'll come around.
There wasn't a way around it.
It's never comfortable, having to choose who lives and dies.
Saying thank you seems... crude. All the same, you deserve thanks. You've saved us from an agonizing death.
Your indecision disgusts me.
I never want to deal with anything like this again. And I certainly wouldn't trouble you with it. Good day.
There are no more infected Gen'Dai on the scanners. You've done it.
I knew it could be done without sacrificing them. They're as much the victims as we are.
I'm just glad you stopped the disease. You've saved a lot of civilians today.
She came up with the vaccine. All I did was deliver it.
Doctor Fash did the hard part.
You had the more dangerous job by far, but thank you.
I'm glad they could be saved.
You saved a lot of unnecessary bloodshed. I can't thank you enough.
We all owe you our gratitude, especially the Gen'Dai. Thank you.
Pulling that off was brilliant, even for me.
You're lucky I showed up.
Your modesty suits you. At least you kept us from having to sacrifice all those Gen'Dai.
You can't be finished yet. I'm certain there are plenty more Gen'Dai for you to butcher.
She meant to say there are still more infected Gen'Dai out there. They all need to be removed before we're safe.
I'm still getting reports of infected Gen'Dai out there. Sorry, but you need to keep looking.
I'm reasonably certain that the antidote will work at this new concentration.
Look, doc, I won't risk our safety on "reasonably certain." They've got to go.
You can't have the Gen'Dai butchered wholesale! At least let me try the antidote first.
Unless the Force protects you from contamination and disease, I wouldn't get any closer to that body.
I'd step back if I were you, Major. That body's a class-two contamination hazard.
Unless you've got a decontamination suit under that outfit, I'd steer clear of that body.
I'm on Belsavis to assist. What seems to be the problem?
Perhaps I can help you.
Now there's a loaded question... well, at the moment, we have a virus that's tearing through the sector.
If it's that deadly, why is it just sitting out?
I don't scare that easy.
That's the doctor's fault. She's trying to study this virus that's tearing up the sector.
I'm not interested in catching whatever he had.
No need to tell me twice.
Good choice. This virus is tearing the whole sector apart. It's not pretty.
The disease is exceptional--it spent a millennia locked away, and when the Empire blew open its vault, it came out even deadlier.
It attacks the central nervous system. Seizures and agonizing death follow in hours.
Unless you happen to be a Gen'Dai. Make sure you mention that, doc.
Sounds like the virus needed to be locked up forever.
Letting it out was a bad idea.
I don't think the Empire knew what they were letting out, but we almost had it contained 'til the Gen'Dai got infected.
Are the Gen'Dai immune to the disease?
What about the Gen'Dai?
They're immune to everything--disease, blasters, planetary bombardment.
There's more bad news. Great.
There's no good news when the Gen'Dai are involved. Imagine a giant killing machine, then make it immortal.
They were sent to Belsavis because their species is violent and almost impossible to kill.
Even the disease won't kill them, it just incubates in their tissues. They become carriers.
We need help to wipe out the infected Gen'Dai. If they aren't killed, they'll eventually infect the entire planet.
Or we could cure them. Jansen doesn't agree, so that makes you these creatures' best hope--I can give you the antidote.
You're right, we should try to cure them.
I'm here to save lives.
Here you go. Just use it on the infected ones.
Be careful. They're sluggish now, but once you cure them, they'll be back to their warlike selves.
I'm sorry, doctor, but he's right. Killing them protects all of us.
Killing the Gen'Dai is safest.
I wish there was another way. I'd hoped you would agree with me.
The Gen'Dai tend to cluster around the old vaults. You'll be able to find them there.
Sorry, no time to talk. We're getting some strange reports from the field.
